transportAdvice: Chengdu has an extensive metro network that connects major tourist areas, making it easy and affordable to get around without a car. Taxis and ride-hailing services are widely available, and the city center is walkable for short distances between attractions.

weather.description: Cool and overcast with frequent fog and little sunshine, typical of Chengdu's basin climate in winter.
Still cool and grey with occasional light rain as winter begins to ease.
Temperatures rise noticeably and spring flowers begin to appear, though rain becomes more frequent.
Pleasant spring weather with mild temperatures and occasional showers, a popular time to visit.
Warm and increasingly humid with regular afternoon rain showers as the wet season approaches.
Hot and rainy with high humidity; expect frequent heavy downpours throughout the month.
The hottest and one of the wettest months, with intense heat and frequent thunderstorms.
Still very hot and humid with continued heavy rainfall; outdoor sightseeing can be uncomfortable.
Temperatures begin to drop but rain remains frequent, making this a transitional and often damp month.
Cooler and more comfortable with decreasing rain, though overcast skies remain common.
Mild and often foggy as autumn deepens, with little rain but persistent cloud cover.
Cold and grey with heavy fog typical of Chengdu winters; sunshine is rare but crowds are thin.
